paper_abstract: In this paper, we derive the upper bound of bit-error rate (BER) performance and diversity gain for a decode-and-forward (DF) cooperative system. Either maximal-ratio combining (MRC) or cooperative MRC(C-MRC) is employed at the receiver in the presence of independent, non-identical Nakagami-m fading. Both analytical and simulation results show that C-MRC takes advantage of spatial diversity more efficiently and thus achieves the same or better performance and diversity order as compared to MRC. paper_title: Performance and diversity analysis of decode-and-forward cooperative system over Nakagami-m fading channels
